channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for UT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for UT

item.title: Report E-2023070172
item.description:
Report E-2023070172

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-26T15:11:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-20
  • City: W VALLEY CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 20, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of Zep extra 5GL was damaged by a load shift and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar to remediate the site. GrayMar personnel deployed granular absorbents to the sodium hydroxide-impacted trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents, PPE, and damaged jug were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for terminal disposal.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: LEAKING CORROSIVE LIQUID DURING TRANSIT. UNLOADED AND PLACED INSIDE A HAZMAT BAG AND A RED HAZMAT TOTE. DescribePack: LOOSE CAP LEAKED ENTIRE CONTENT INSIDE AN UNSUITABLE LARGED WET BOX SOAKING THE BOX AND SOILING ALL CONTENTS INSIDE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED INSIDE A HAZMAT BAG AND A RED HAZMAT TOTE.
